title: Writing Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi
Interview Descriptions: Filled out an application with resume, transcript, and three letters of rec. Also answered some short essay questions about my writing history. Received a call to schedule an interview. Pretty positive experience!
Interview Questions: How well do you collaborate with others?

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi
Interview Descriptions: Multiple rounds, concluding in a final round full day interview, found out I didn't get it from an automated message from the recruiting system. After all that, would've been nice to get something a little more courteous.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Library Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi
Interview Descriptions: Environment was comfortable! I felt listened to and everyone was kind to me there. I didn’t have any issues and I have no complaints about the people who work there
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses. And why I wanted the job

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi
Interview Descriptions: The interview process began with a zoom call. Then, I received an email invitation for an on campus interview. The on campus interview consisted of a teaching demo, a job talk, an interview, and meetings with doctoral students, the department chair, and the dean. The job talk was low stakes. The only attendees were doc students and the search committee.
Interview Questions: What is your ideal learning environment?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi
Interview Descriptions: It was quite easy and the hiring manager was easy to communicate with. They did allow me to explain my resume and transcripts which I think made a difference. Overall, good experience.
Interview Questions: Can you explain what is ohm's law?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi (Corpus Christi, TX) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: They asked me if if think I'm qualified enough and my availability. Mathematics tutors are always in demand and that's why interview process is not very strict, they just need tutors for athletes.
Interview Questions: Will you be able not to fraternize with student athletes?

title: Laboratory Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi
Interview Descriptions: Had an interview in front of the hiring managers through Zoom. Questions asked were about my work experience and my familiarity of writing instrumental procedures. Overall interview was straight to the point.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself. 
Related work experience?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi (Austin, TX) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: good overall, it was a zoom call. there were 3 people and asked mainly leadership questions and day to day life questions. It was overall an easy interview process. and got an offer after 3 months so they are quite lazy above that
Interview Questions: Tell me about your day-to-day functions

title: Professional Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi
Interview Descriptions: A day long process starting from the breakfast and ending up with the dinner. Meeting with different professors, department head, dean’s associates. Human Resources, distance learning office, and students. Then you will be taken for a tour to different buildings on campus and get to know all buildings.
Interview Questions: Are you getting interviews at other places?

title: Copy and Print Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is easy as long as you have the proper paperwork ready.  It's especially easy for students in their first or second semester given their availability throughout the week.
Interview Questions: Are you able to lift 30 pounds of weight?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Was pretty good, really fast, not hard questions, the person was able to listen to me, I could ask more questions about the role and my past work experience and what can I contribute to the role
Interview Questions: They asked me about my past work experience

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview then in person interview. In person interview consisted of a one on one interview then a panel interview with the team. Pretty straight forward interview process. Great experience.
Interview Questions: Why are you qualified for this position?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi (Corpus Christi, TX)
Interview Descriptions: the process is easy and relatively fast. I submitted my application and got a call a few days later for a onsite interview. The interview is easy, just a couple of behavioral questions to see how would you react to certain scenarios. A couple of days later I received the offer.
Interview Questions: how many times you think is appropriate to miss work?

title: Soar Program Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi
Interview Descriptions: It was brief and simple. What is your classification, what is your major. etc. They were very professional and friendly. They understood that you are a college student and that grades are important. You have to keep a high GPA in order to continue working.
Interview Questions: What is your major?

title: IT Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi (Corpus Christi, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied on Handshake and after reviwing the job information I submitted my resume. After a week I got an email scheduling a job interview. After another extra week I had the interview and I was in what would be my future work desk, and got interviewed by 5 collegues. They asked me why I was suitable for the job and if I had any experience with technology. Mostly, the queastions were based on my personality.
Interview Questions: How proficient are you utilizing Mac computers?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi (Corpus Christi, TX)
Interview Descriptions: One direct interview with manager.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions mostly.

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was drawn out and I had accepted another offer before I heard back from the hiring manager.  The entire process kept me wondering about the outcome, and overall, it could be improved.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my leadership style, strengths, weaknesses, words to describe me, how others would describe me, etc.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi (Corpus Christi, TX) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with three people at the same time. All from management level. They were nice and professional. They asked relatively easier questions and mostly conversational questions. They were specifically interested in the academic background and research skills.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths and weaknesses?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
What is your biggest accomplishment?

title: Comptable Général Multi-sociétés Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi
Interview Descriptions: Roundabout visits to various people in departments on campus. Opportunity to learn problems the university faces and provide prospective solutions. Opportunity to "size up" the administration to see if leadership has the ability to act on the solutions provided. Brief campus tour. Very brief tour of the city.
Interview Questions: Mock television interview to test crisis communications management.

title: Freelance Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi (Corpus Christi, TX) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: They just asked me for examples of my work, a referral, and what equipment I would be using.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi (Corpus Christi, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: After submitting the resume. I got a call for the interview. The interviewer(my boss) goes over my previous work. Asks me if I can do the given job which is programming.
Interview Questions: All questions were trivial

title: IT Research Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi (Corpus Christi, TX) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the department of Graduate Studies, they set up an interview, I met with the manager who was hiring, she asked some questions and my availability .
Interview Questions: What are your technical skills?

title: Field Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at TAMU-Corpus Christi (College Station, TX) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: was one of the best experiences of my life. ireally cannot put it in words beleive me its was great. the employers were really freindly and I cannot wait to work with them again. They treated us with utmost respect something not seen in my home country.
Interview Questions: Why this company?
